conclusion: The graph shows the square of the velocity (v^2) plotted against displacement (x) for two cars, A and B.
The slope of the line in such a graph represents the acceleration (a) of the car, derived from the formula v^2 = u^2 + 2ax, where u is the initial velocity.
The line representing Car A is steeper than the line representing Car B.
Car A has a greater acceleration than Car B.
